Tannin Characteristics: Barely noticeable, clean and fine perlage typical of metodo classico sparkling wines.
Body Characteristics: Balanced, elegant, and harmonious with a creamy texture.
Finish: Fresh and persistent with notes of ripe fruit and crusty bread.
Aroma: Intense and refined with ripe golden apples, white flowers, and a delicate yeast note.
Flavor: Fresh and clean with hints of ripe fruit, hazelnut, and a slight toastiness.
Vinification: Metodo classico with second fermentation in bottle; careful selection of yeasts for refinement.
Color: Bright straw yellow with a fine and persistent perlage.
General Recommended Accompanies: Excellent as an aperitif and pairs well with seafood, appetizers, and light first courses.
Summary: Ferrari Brut Trento DOC is a metodo classico sparkling wine from Trentino made from 100% Chardonnay. It offers refined aromas of golden apple, white flowers, and subtle yeast. The palate is fresh, clean, and balanced with a fine mousse and a persistent finish.

Tannin Characteristics: Delicate and balanced, with subtle structure and a creamy mousse.
Body Characteristics: Light, fine, and balanced with a harmonious blend of flavors.
Finish: Long and persistent, marked by freshness and minerality.
Aroma: Ethereal and precise, with white stone fruits, fresh fruits, floral notes, and subtle biscuit.
Flavor: Apple, crisp pear, citrus, and roasted notes with fine vinosity.
Vinification: Low-temperature vinification in stainless steel tanks, over 50% reserve wines.
Aging: 5 to 6 years (bottle), longer in magnums and larger formats.
Color: Straw yellow with fine bubbles and a persistent mousse.
General Recommended Accompanies: Perfect as an aperitif, pairs well with a wide variety of dishes.
Summary: Billecart-Salmon Brut Reserve is a traditional Champagne blend made with Pinot Meunier, Chardonnay, and Pinot Noir. This Extra Brut sparkling wine offers delicate texture, precise fruit expression, and a long, mineral-driven finish.

Tannin Characteristics: Delicate and subtle, allowing fruit and acidity to shine.
Body Characteristics: Elegant and refreshing, with a clean mouthfeel.
Finish: Bright and citrus-driven with crisp acidity.
Aroma: Golden apple, Bosc pear, red cherry, and white blossom.
Flavor: Green fruit, lemon citrus peel, and a refreshing tartness.
Vinification: Methode traditionelle; bottle-aged sur-lie for 15–18 months. Final dosage: 7g/L.
General Recommended Accompanies: Great for relaxed evenings, seafood, and sauteed or fried foods.
Summary: Faire La Fête Brut Rose is a methode traditionelle Rose from Limoux, France. Blended from Chardonnay, Chenin Blanc, and Pinot Noir, it features aromas of apple, pear, cherry, and white blossom. On the palate, it is tart and citrusy with a crisp, refreshing finish.

Tannin Characteristics: Fine and delicate, structured by a gentle mousse.
Body Characteristics: Elegant, complex, and balanced with persistent mouthfeel.
Finish: Lingering flavors of fresh apples and lemons with finesse.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, citrus, spice, and yeast.
Flavor: Fresh apples, lemons, citrus zest, tropical notes.
Vinification: Stainless steel fermentation with temperature control. Uses 20% reserve wine. Wines aged in Champagne’s chalky cellars.
Maturation: Minimum 20 months; aged in cellars at 52°F.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pairs well with light seafood dishes, creamy cheeses, and as a festive aperitif.
Stella Recommended: Fish of the Day, Risotto, Seafood
Summary: Perrier-Jouët Grand Brut NV is a refined Champagne from the heart of the Champagne region. Composed of Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier, and Chardonnay, this brut cuvee delivers tropical fruit, citrus, spice, and yeast aromas, with a lingering and balanced palate.

Tannin Characteristics: None noticeable, enhancing the sweetness and freshness of the wine.
Body Characteristics: Delicate and sweet, with a creamy texture and fine bubbles.
Finish: Fresh with hints of apricot and floral lingering aromas.
Aroma: Ripe peach, apricot, rose petals, acacia flowers, and ginger.
Flavor: Sweet and delicate with fresh apricot, peach, and floral notes.
Vinification: Gentle pressing, cold decanting, stored at low temperatures; fermented in autoclave to 5.5% ABV, then stopped and sterile filtered.
General Recommended Accompanies: Excellent with desserts, fruit tarts, or as a light aperitif.
Summary: Vietti Moscato d’Asti DOCG is a lightly sparkling wine from Piemonte made from 100% Moscato. It offers fresh and intense aromas of peach, apricot, and floral notes, with a sweet, delicate palate and modest acidity.

Wine Name: Val d’Oca Prosecco Treviso Extra Dry
Tannin Characteristics: None noticeable, enhancing freshness and drinkability.
Body Characteristics: Crisp and harmonious with a soft and easy-drinking texture.
Finish: Soft finish with lingering citrus notes.
Aroma: White stone fruits, apple, and wildflowers.
Flavor: Bright citrus fruits, soft and refreshing.
Vinification: Fermented at 16–18°C, aged on lees, second fermentation and rest in autoclave.
Color: Pale straw yellow with lively bubbles.
General Recommended Accompanies: Excellent as an aperitif, or with savory focaccia, white meats, sweets, or seafood.
Summary: Val d’Oca Prosecco DOC Treviso Extra Dry is a Charmat method sparkling wine from Veneto made with Glera, Pinot Grigio, and Chardonnay. It shows aromas of white stone fruits, apple, and wildflowers, with bright citrus flavors and a soft finish. Perfect for aperitifs or pairing with light dishes.

Tannin Characteristics: Delicate structure with soft tannins supporting sweet fruit.
Body Characteristics: Vivacious and harmonious, with a soft, fresh mouthfeel.
Finish: Sweet and balanced with floral and red fruit lingering tones.
Aroma: Delicate floral notes of violet and ripe red fruit.
Flavor: Luxuriously sweet, fresh and fruity with balanced acidity.
Vinification: Made from organically farmed vines with restricted yields for quality.
Color: Bright ruby red with persistent bubbles.
General Recommended Accompanies: Excellent with desserts or as a sweet aperitif.
Stella Recommended: Baked Garlic Butter Lobster, Frutti di Bosco
Summary: Quercioli Dolce Reggiano Lambrusco DOC is a sweet sparkling red wine from Emilia-Romagna. Made with 50% Salamino and 50% Marani Lambrusco, it shows bright ruby color, delicate violet aroma, and a vivacious, sweet palate balanced with freshness.

Tannin Characteristics: Very delicate, no astringency, allowing freshness and fruit to dominate.
Body Characteristics: Elegant and textural with bright acidity and slight minerality.
Finish: Lingering notes of sea spray and citrus pith.
Aroma: Mandarin orange, cherry blossom, wild strawberry, and chalky minerals.
Flavor: Yellow plum, nectarine, salty minerality, and citrus.
Style: Rose blend in the tradition of Provence
Vinification: 80% direct-press into stainless steel tanks, 20% cold-soaked for additional color and structure. Fermented with native yeasts.
Maturation: Blended and cold-stabilized, bottled in January 2022.
General Recommended Accompanies: Great with salmon, sushi, anchovies, sausages, fried chicken, and Mediterranean tapas.
Summary: Patelin de Tablas Rose is a Provence-style blend from Paso Robles made with Grenache, Mourvèdre, Counoise, and Vermentino. It features aromas of citrus and cherry blossom with flavors of stone fruits, salty minerality, and bright acidity.

Tannin Characteristics: None noticeable; emphasizes minerality and freshness.
Body Characteristics: Clean and mineral-driven with bright acidity.
Finish: Lingering mineral notes with subtle fruit tones.
Aroma: Aromas of stone fruits and melon.
Flavor: Melon and stone fruits with mineral backbone and medium body.
Vinification: De-stemmed and left on skins for 12 hours before fermentation in stainless steel.
Maturation: Six months on lees in stainless steel.
Color: Light straw with a hint of salmon.
General Recommended Accompanies: Excellent as an aperitivo or with light grilled fish like sashimi, pesce crudo, or ceviche.
Summary: Scarpetta Pinot Grigio 2024 is a crisp, mineral-driven white wine from Friuli-Venezia Giulia. With aromas of melon and stone fruits, and a palate of vibrant acidity and medium body, it’s perfect with light seafood or as an aperitivo.

Tannin Characteristics: Very subtle, allowing fruit and freshness to take center stage.
Body Characteristics: Delicately refreshing with floral lift and slight texture from lees aging.
Finish: Delicate fruit tones with a zesty grapefruit note.
Flavor: Elegant freshness with citrus zest and aromatic fruit.
Vinification: Cold skin maceration, temperature-controlled fermentation, aged on lees.
General Recommended Accompanies: Seafood tapas, grilled fish, lemon-fried squid, prawns al ajillo, tuna empanadas.
Summary: Symphonie Rose 2024 is a certified organic and vegan Rose from Provence. With floral, peach, and citrus aromas and a zesty grapefruit finish, it's a delicately refreshing wine ideal for seafood and Mediterranean tapas.
